briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Copy constructor, uses reference counting.

detaileddescription.para: To create a real copy, use Copy() member function instead.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the strings in labels array.
Values for choices. If NULL, indexes are used. Otherwise must have at least count elements.

briefdescription.para: Constructor overload taking wxChar strings.

detaileddescription.para: This constructor is provided mostly for compatibility, prefer to use one of the other constructor overloads in the new code.

parameterdescription.para: Values for choices. If NULL, indexes are used. Otherwise must have at least the same size as labels.

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

parameterdescription.para: Values for choices. If empty, indexes are used. Otherwise must have at least the same size as labels.

briefdescription.para: Simple interface constructor.
Destructor.
Adds to current.

detaileddescription.para: If did not have own copies, creates them now. If was empty, identical to set except that creates copies.

parameterdescription.para: Number of the strings in labels array.
Values for choices. If NULL, indexes are used. Otherwise must have at least count elements.

briefdescription.para: Adds to current.

detaileddescription.para: This overload is provided mostly for compatibility, prefer to use one of the other ones in the new code.

parameterdescription.para: Values for added choices. If empty, relevant entry indexes are used. Otherwise must have at least the same size as labels.

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
Adds a single choice item.

parameterdescription.para: Value for added choice. If unspecified, index is used.

briefdescription.para: Adds a single item, with bitmap.
Adds a single item with full entry information.
Adds a single item, sorted.
Assigns choices data, using reference counting.

detaileddescription.para: To create a real copy, use Copy() member function instead.

briefdescription.para: Assigns data from another set of choices.
Deletes all items.
Returns a real copy of the choices.
Gets an unsigned number identifying this list.
Returns label of item.
Returns number of items.
Returns value of item.
Returns array of values matching the given strings.

detaileddescription.para: Unmatching strings result in wxPG_INVALID_VALUE entry in array.

briefdescription.para: Returns array of indices matching given strings.

detaileddescription.para: Unmatching strings are added to 'unmatched', if not NULL.

briefdescription.para: Returns index of item with given label.
Returns index of item with given value.
Inserts a single item.
Inserts a single item with full entry information.
Returns false if this is a constant empty set of choices, which should not be modified.
Returns item at given index.
Returns item at given index.
Removes count items starting at position nIndex.
Sets contents from lists of strings and values.

detaileddescription.para: This is similar to calling Clear() and the corresponding overload of Add().

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
Creates exclusive copy of current choices.
Returns data, increases refcount.
Returns plain data ptr - no refcounting stuff is done.
Changes ownership of data to you.
Returns array of choice labels.
Helper class for managing choices of wxPropertyGrid properties.

detaileddescription.para: Each entry can have label, value, bitmap, text colour, and background colour.

wxPGChoices uses reference counting, similar to other wxWidgets classes. This means that assignment operator and copy constructor only copy the reference and not the actual data. Use Copy() member function to create a real copy.

simplesect.para: If you do not specify value for entry, index is used.
